Others: The regular season finale between the Cleveland Guardians and Houston Astros was canceled due to rain, preventing José Ramírez from a shot at hitting his 40th home run and joining the exclusive 40-40 club.
The Guardians finished the season at 92-69 and will host Game 1 of the ALDS on Oct. 5.
The Astros are scheduled to open their AL wild-card series at home on Tuesday.
The game was canceled after a 3-hour, 5-minute delay due to concerns over safety for the players and the field conditions.
